2017 WW18 Purley-FPGA Server SKX H0/LBG B1 Gold Release Announcement (\n BKC #20)

\n \n \n

DEG Platform Integration Team

\n \n
\n

The DEG platform Integration team announces the release of 2017 WW18 Purley-FPGA Server SKX H0/LBG B1 Gold release package for Intel internal use. The release is based on OS of\n \n RHEL7.3\n server. The auto-installer packages are available in the Artifactory server (both SH site and OR site). Any questions please contact Bei, Ling.

\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
Auto InstallerSH Artifactory ServerOR Artifactory Server
RHEL7.3WithoutOS_BKC-PurleyFPGA_BkcLinux_71.119317-2017WW18.zip\n \n
RHEL7.3Serverx86_64.zip\n 		WithoutOS_BKC-PurleyFPGA_BkcLinux_71.119317-2017WW18.zip\n \n
RHEL7.3Serverx86_64.zip\n
\n

*Note: Please select the server which is closer to your region to get the better data accessing/downloading performance

\n
\n\n
\n
\n   Summary \n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n \n \n \n \n \n \n
\n

Test Result:

Finish Gold test execution\non RHEL7.3-BU2. Please visit HPQC for test details. Refer to the installation guide for\nthe BKC package installation

\n\n\n\n

    Purley FPGA (RP Board: Neon City FPGA)

o   Total test cases: 39; Passed test cases is 35 and pass rate is 89.74%. 

o  \nTest coverage:  

SKX-FPGA H0 VIS/LBG-4 B1: Run full BKC test case  and P&P test

SKX-FPGA H0 VIS/LBG-T B1: Run QAT test case

SKX-FPGA B0 ES2/LBG-4 B1: Run boot up test and AAL test case

o   Power cycling (G3/S5/Warm-reboot) are not covered in BKC test due to the key sighting 5345509,  FPGA team is working on the fix.


Sighting Update:

Key Sightings:

\n\n

[2016_WW44\nBKC][BIOS:106_D11][Neon city FPGA]Occasionally cat error and hang at code \'A9\'\nduring warmboot cycling tests 5345509


\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n

Full sighting list can be found in HSD


Known Issue/Errata:

\xc2\xb7       \n5345546 [2016_WW45 BKC][BIOS:107_D07][Neon\ncity FPGA]WOL function is still working when disabled in BIOS.  

\n\n

Status:  No\nfix . Purley-FPGA is aligned with Purley-2S/4S Launch collateral. Details\ncan be found 5345546 in HSD

\n\n

 

\n\n

\xc2\xb7       \n5345493 [2016_WW43 BKC][BIOS:105_D11][Neon\ncity FPGA] Entering "Platform Configuration -> PCH Configuration"\nresets other saved change. 

\n\n

Status:  No\nfix . Purley-FPGA is aligned with Purley2S/4S Launch collateral. Details\ncan be found 5345493 in HSD

\n\n

 

\n\n

 5345843 [2017_WW03\nBKC][BIOS:118_R01][Neon city FPGA] P3V3 voltage on Purley-FPGA boards is 1.1V\nwhen system under S5 state 

\n\nStatus: No fix. Details can be found 5345843 in HSD

\n
\n   HW Rework \n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n
\n \n \n \n \n
\n

Key Workaround (detail guide is here)

\n\n

Please\nuse PCIe Video card instead of onboard BMC video due to known BMC issue

\n\n

 

Pedigree\nand Board Jumper Settings: guide

\n\n\n\n

Note: Only mandatory and necessary rework\nis implemented by BKC team

\n\n

l  \nMandatory\nrework FPGA JTAG chain missing CPU1 TCK resistor

\n\n

l  \nMandatory\nrework to replace FPGA KR RX AC Caps

\n\n

l  \nMandatory\nrework add a pull down to RSMRST

\n\n

l  \nMandatory\nrework to update VR FW

\n\n

l  \nCPLD\nupdates to address IFWI issue with 2 SKX FPGA CPUs populated

\n\n

l  \nRequired\nCPLD updates to address reset and FSC issues

\n\n

l  \nRequired\nVR FW update to address VMCP current misreporting issues

\n\n

l  \nRequired\nVR FW update for boards -301 to address VMCP current misreporting issues

\n\n

Notes: To subscribe or unsubscribe to the mailing list please\nclick here and select "Purley FPGA Subscription".

InformationQuick Guide
BKC Artifactory Access

Link (SH server): https://ubit-artifactory-sh.intel.com/artifactory/webapp/#/artifacts/browse/tree/General/DEG-Purley-local/Release/Purley_FPGA

Link (OR server): https://ubit-artifactory-or.intel.com/artifactory/webapp/#/artifacts/browse/tree/General/DEG-Purley-sh-cache/Release/Purley_FPGA\n 

Steps for applying the permission:

  • Go to EAM website: https://eam.intel.com/EAMWeb/RequestAccess/DisplayTree.aspx?TopNode=757719
  • Apply for the "Project viewer" role
  • Use your windows credentials for authentication

BKC One Stop Shop

Link: https://dcg-oss.intel.com/homepage_view/16/

Steps for applying the permission:

  • Go to EAM website: https://eam.intel.com/EAMWeb/RequestAccess/DisplayTree.aspx?TopNode=829001
  • Navigate to:"BKC -- Purley"
  • Apply for the "User" or "Ingredient Owner" role
  • Use your windows credentials for authentication

Contact Person: Bei, Ling
